title: Raj Foody (Jeet Raj) single-page marketing site

requirements.summary: Build a responsive single-page homepage that prominently displays “Raj Foody” and “Jeet Raj”.
acceptanceCriteria: The homepage renders without errors and is usable on mobile and desktop breakpoints.
The text "Raj Foody" and "Jeet Raj" appear on the page in prominent positions (e.g., hero + footer).

file_operations.description: Create the single-page marketing layout shell (hero + sections + footer) and ensure “Raj Foody” and “Jeet Raj” are prominently rendered (hero and footer).
Add a simple page layout wrapper (container, section spacing, header/footer slots) used by App to keep structure consistent.

requirements.summary: Implement standard homepage sections with anchor navigation, menu list, gallery grid, testimonials, and contact form UI.
acceptanceCriteria: Navbar links scroll to the correct sections on the same page.
Menu section displays at least 6 items with name, price, and description.
Contact section includes a visible form with fields: Name, Phone (or Email), Message, and a Submit button (form can be non-functional if backend is not implemented).

file_operations.description: Create a top navigation bar with anchor links to required sections (Hero, About, Menu, Why Choose Us, Gallery, Testimonials, Contact) and mobile-friendly responsive behavior.

Implement the hero section with English headline + short tagline, and a primary CTA button that scrolls to Contact. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Button) for consistent styling. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Implement the About section with an English heading and editable placeholder paragraph sourced from the centralized config.

Implement the Menu/Offerings section rendering at least 6 items (name/price/description) from config; use card styling (shadcn-ui Card where appropriate). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Implement the Why Choose Us section with 3–5 highlight bullets/cards sourced from config (icons optional).
Implement a responsive gallery image grid (4 images) with captions optional; images sourced from config and mapped to generated assets.
Implement Testimonials section with 3 items (name + short quote) sourced from config; use consistent card styling.

Implement Contact section with placeholder phone/email/address/opening hours plus a non-functional contact form UI (Name, Phone or Email, Message, Submit). Use shadcn-ui form primitives (Input/Textarea/Button) for consistent styling. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire all created sections into the single page in the required order and ensure section elements have matching ids for anchor scrolling (no orphan sections).

requirements.summary: Apply a warm, food-themed design system (palette, typography, spacing) with consistent buttons/cards and hierarchy.
acceptanceCriteria: The UI uses a consistent color palette and typography across all sections.
Primary/secondary buttons have consistent styling and hover/focus states.
The site maintains clear visual hierarchy (hero > sections > cards).

file_operations.description: Define global CSS variables and base styles for a warm, appetizing palette (avoid blue/purple), typography, and consistent section spacing. Ensure focus/hover styles are visible and consistent site-wide.
Adjust/extend Tailwind theme tokens (if needed) to support the site’s warm palette and consistent radii/shadows without introducing new global stylesheet entry points.

Add a small shared theme helper (e.g., reusable className strings for primary/secondary buttons, cards, section padding) to keep styling consistent across sections; used by section components and layout.

requirements.summary: Create a centralized, editable frontend content/config layer and render all marketing content from it.
acceptanceCriteria: Business name, owner name, and menu items are sourced from a centralized configuration object/file.
Changing the config values updates the rendered UI accordingly.

file_operations.description: Create a centralized config object containing editable business info (shop name, owner name, tagline, about text, menu items, highlights, testimonials, contact placeholders, opening hours, and gallery image references).
Refactor App to read business/shop content from the centralized config and pass relevant slices into each section component (no duplicated hardcoded copy across components).
Update Hero to receive and render shop name/owner name/tagline from the centralized config.
Update Menu to receive and render menu items from the centralized config (minimum 6).
Update Contact to receive and render contact placeholders/opening hours from the centralized config.

requirements.summary: Add the required generated images under frontend/public/assets/generated and wire them into Hero and Gallery.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist in frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced directly by the frontend.
Hero uses the hero image; Gallery uses the gallery images in a grid layout.

Add the generated static asset file at this exact path for use as the Hero background/feature image (no backend routing).
Add the generated static asset file at this exact path for use in the Gallery grid (no backend routing).

Reference the exact generated image paths (frontend/public/assets/generated/raj-foody-hero.dim_1600x900.png and the 4 gallery images) inside the centralized content config so Hero/Gallery render from config.
Wire the hero image from config to render frontend/public/assets/generated/raj-foody-hero.dim_1600x900.png as the hero visual (direct static reference).

Wire gallery images from config to render a responsive grid using frontend/public/assets/generated/raj-foody-gallery-1.dim_1200x800.png, raj-foody-gallery-2.dim_1200x800.png, raj-foody-gallery-3.dim_1200x800.png, raj-foody-gallery-4.dim_1200x800.png (direct static references).
